channel.title: @help@ running two servers = same time - answered

item.title: @help@ running two servers = same time - answered
item.dc:creator: @p00n99range p00n99range
item.description:
@p00n99range wrote:

[quote=“Vhenom, post:2, topic:414997”][quote author=p00n99range link=topic=516958.msg3754332#msg3754332 date=1316304985]
@HELP@ <>~NO FLAMING ON THIS TOPIC~<>

How can I run two servers at once. I want to run a 317, at the same time i want to run my 502 that I coded. I tried a couple different things but it does not seem to work. How could i go about doing this on the same computer??
[/quote]
Cant your already using port 43594[/quote]

Couldn’t I portforward to another main port?

Read full topic
item.source: @help@ running two servers = same time - answered

item.title: @help@ running two servers = same time - answered
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

Run them on two different ports.

Read full topic

item.title: @help@ running two servers = same time - answered
item.dc:creator: @p00n99range p00n99range
item.description:
@p00n99range wrote:

@HELP@ <>~NO FLAMING ON THIS TOPIC~<>

QUESTION:

ANSWER:

1) Portforward by going to : portforward.com 2) Portforward to the port 5555 3) Change client + server side port to 5555. 4) Compile and run two servers

Read full topic
